intro: Osmelia subrotundifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf osmelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale yellow flowers, which are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Osmelia subrotundifolia is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks.
